rename.from: The usage of `NewRequestWithValues(t, "PATCH", url, data) is incorrect in tests
rename.to: The usage of `NewRequestWithValues(t, "PATCH", url, data) doesn't work in tests

rename.from: The usage of `NewRequestWithValues(t, "PATCH", url, data) doesn't work in tests
rename.to: The usage of `NewRequestWithValues(t, "PATCH", url, data)` doesn't work in tests

body:
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/ea04b8dd-5bdf-4482-bb28-44f179fd0769)
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/18380374/f31f17cb-fd5a-455a-8b59-99f25c0d840d)
`theObj` is empty, so in this function, we will always set empty data. But `ctx.Req.Form` has the data, so maybe something changed?
For `Form`, if the type of the field is `*string`, it doesn't work, but if it is `string`, it works.
Any plan to finish it, API requests with form type body can not be applied correctly which looks like a big bug.
Then the next step is adding result checking in theses tests to confirm whether it works.
Can you help to send a PR?

It seems that it does not work. Still got empty items.
I will send a PR to test it first, then let's fix it.

issue.title: Add result check in TestAPIEditUser

issue.body:
Fix #29514
there are too many usage of `NewRequestWithValues`, so there's no need to check all of them.
Just one is enough I think.
